required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety & Efficacy Of Eculizumab In The Prevention Of AMR In Sensitized Recipients Of A Kidney Transplant From A Deceased Donor
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Arm, Multicenter Trial to Determine Safety and Efficacy of Eculizumab in the Prevention of Antibody Mediated Rejection (AMR) in Sensitized Recipients of a Kidney Transplant From a Deceased Donor.

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To evaluate the safety and potential efficacy of eculizumab to prevent AMR in sensitized recipients of deceased donor kidney transplants.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-transplantation Treatment Failure In The First 9 Weeks Post Transplantation
primary_outcome.description: Results are reported for post-transplantation treatment failure and composite endpoints, defined as the occurrence of biopsy-proven acute antibody-mediated rejection (AMR), graft loss, death, or loss to follow-up (including discontinuation) in the first 9 weeks post transplantation. The diagnosis of acute AMR (occurring within the first 9 weeks post transplantation) was based on kidney allograft dysfunction and a biopsy performed due to suspected rejection, proteinuria, increased serum creatinine, or acute tubular necrosis. Treatment failure was the occurrence of at least 1 of the composite endpoint components by Week 9 post transplantation. A participant experiencing multiple events was only counted once for the composite endpoint.

other_outcome.measure: Cumulative Incidence Function (CIF) Of Other Adverse Events (AEs) Of Interest At Month 12
other_outcome.description: Specific analyses of other AEs of interest that occurred at Month 12 included cumulative incidence of clinically significant infection (CSI); post-transplant lymphoproliferative disease (PTLD); malignancies; biopsy-proven acute cellular rejection (ACR) of any grade meeting Banff 2007 criteria; allograft loss for reasons other than AMR. CSIs were defined as infections (confirmed by culture, biopsy, genomic, or serologic findings) that required hospitalization or anti-infective treatment, or otherwise deemed significant by the Investigator. CSI subcategories of interest included cytomegalovirus (CMV) disease; BK virus disease; encapsulated bacterial infection; fungal infections; aspergillus infections. Results are reported as CIF, where a larger CIF indicates a higher incidence of an AE, and were calculated using Statistical Analysis System software and macro CIF. A summary of serious and all other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

other_outcome.measure: Participants That Developed Severe ACR (Other AE Of Interest) At Month 12
other_outcome.description: This outcome measure focuses on the other AE of interest, severe ACR, which occurred at Month 12. It pertains specifically to the number of participants who developed severe ACR that did not respond to thymoglobulin or other lymphocyte-depleting agents. A summary of serious and all other non-serious AEs, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

arm_group.description: Eculizumab 1200 milligrams (mg) was administered intravenously (IV) over 25 to 45 minutes 1 hour prior to kidney allograft reperfusion. Eculizumab 900 mg was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes on post-transplantation Days 1 and 7, and on post-transplantation Days 14, 21, and 28, plus or minus 2 days. Eculizumab 1200 mg was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes on post-transplantation Days 35, 49, and 63, plus or minus 2 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female participants â‰¥18 years old.
2. Participants with Stage V chronic kidney disease who received a kidney transplant from a deceased donor to whom they were sensitized.
3. History of prior exposure to HLA (human leukocyte antigen):
- Prior solid organ or tissue allograft
- Pregnancy
- Blood transfusion
- Prior exposure to specific donor's HLA
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has received treatment with eculizumab at any time prior to enrolling in this study.
2. Blood type (A, B, and O blood glycoproteins-blood type) incompatible with deceased donor.
3. History of severe cardiac disease.
4. Prior splenectomy.

group.title: Eculizumab
group.description: All eculizumab was administered intravenously (IV) over 25 to 45 minutes. Eculizumab 1200 milligrams (mg) was administered approximately 1 hour prior to kidney allograft reperfusion. Eculizumab 900 mg was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes on post-transplantation Days 1 and 7, and on post-transplantation Days 14, 21, and 28, plus or minus 2 days. Eculizumab 1200 mg was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes on post-transplantation Days 35, 49, and 63, plus or minus 2 days.

milestone.title: Received at Least 1 Dose of Study Drug

baseline.population: Safety Population: enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of eculizumab.

Eculizumab 1200 mg was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes on post-transplantation Days 35, 49, and 63, plus or minus 2 days.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Post-transplantation Treatment Failure In The First 9 Weeks Post Transplantation
outcome.description: Results are reported for post-transplantation treatment failure and composite endpoints, defined as the occurrence of biopsy-proven acute antibody-mediated rejection (AMR), graft loss, death, or loss to follow-up (including discontinuation) in the first 9 weeks post transplantation. The diagnosis of acute AMR (occurring within the first 9 weeks post transplantation) was based on kidney allograft dysfunction and a biopsy performed due to suspected rejection, proteinuria, increased serum creatinine, or acute tubular necrosis. Treatment failure was the occurrence of at least 1 of the composite endpoint components by Week 9 post transplantation. A participant experiencing multiple events was only counted once for the composite endpoint.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Population: participants who were enrolled, received a deceased donor kidney transplant, and received at least 1 dose of eculizumab.

group.title: Eculizumab
group.description: All eculizumab was administered IV over 25 to 45 minutes. Eculizumab 1200 mg was administered approximately 1 hour prior to kidney allograft reperfusion. measure.title: Post-transplantation Treatment Failure In The First 9 Weeks Post Transplantation
measure.description: Results are reported for post-transplantation treatment failure and composite endpoints, defined as the occurrence of biopsy-proven acute antibody-mediated rejection (AMR), graft loss, death, or loss to follow-up (including discontinuation) in the first 9 weeks post transplantation. The diagnosis of acute AMR (occurring within the first 9 weeks post transplantation) was based on kidney allograft dysfunction and a biopsy performed due to suspected rejection, proteinuria, increased serum creatinine, or acute tubular necrosis. Treatment failure was the occurrence of at least 1 of the composite endpoint components by Week 9 post transplantation. A participant experiencing multiple events was only counted once for the composite endpoint.
measure.population: Full Analysis Population: participants who were enrolled, received a deceased donor kidney transplant, and received at least 1 dose of eculizumab.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of post-transplantation treatment failure rate
analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value was calculated from an exact binomial test, where the null hypothesis was that the true failure rate = 40%.

outcome.title: Cumulative Incidence Function (CIF) Of Other Adverse Events (AEs) Of Interest At Month 12
outcome.description: Specific analyses of other AEs of interest that occurred at Month 12 included cumulative incidence of clinically significant infection (CSI); post-transplant lymphoproliferative disease (PTLD); malignancies; biopsy-proven acute cellular rejection (ACR) of any grade meeting Banff 2007 criteria; allograft loss for reasons other than AMR. CSIs were defined as infections (confirmed by culture, biopsy, genomic, or serologic findings) that required hospitalization or anti-infective treatment, or otherwise deemed significant by the Investigator. CSI subcategories of interest included cytomegalovirus (CMV) disease; BK virus disease; encapsulated bacterial infection; fungal infections; aspergillus infections. Results are reported as CIF, where a larger CIF indicates a higher incidence of an AE, and were calculated using Statistical Analysis System software and macro CIF. A summary of serious and all other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected beginning on the day of transplantation, Day 0, through 12 months post transplantation.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Refractory anaemia with an excess of blasts

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
